A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
it was terrible. It made me feel physical pain. 
the characters are just jokes\, caricatures of themselves. 
there's no epic at all. 
everything is narrated quickly and without feelings. 
all the good things from episode VII are like non existent. one of the biggest questions from VII about Rei parents is resolved like it was nothing and it looks like they had no idea of how to do it. the movie leaves you without any curiosity to see a sequel\, which I'm pretty sure IS NOT what a franchise should do.
the direction? Rian Johnson was able to do wrong almost everything\, especially in filming the dialogues (they're like a lousy series from the 80s).
the writing? well\, there was an idea in it\, but it was developed poorly and without professionalism.
the comedy scenes are just there to entertain the audience and to distract them during that 2 and half hours\, but they don't have an actual use. I couldn't believe what I was seeing at the start of the movie. by the end I was praying for it to finish.
this cannot be saved.
